Jargon Term: dark bleeding and poor blood flow to the esophagus
may represent a compression of the stomach by a hiatal hernia
part of the stomach is extending up into the chest through the diaphragm
you will need to have another endoscopy prior to this procedure as an outpatient
Annotation: Aftercare instructions - Upcoming Schedules - Specialist appointment

Jargon Term: START PANTOPRAZOLE 40mg twice a day until instructed to stop
START SUCRALFATE 1 gram four times a day until instructed to stop. Do not take at the same time as your pantoprazole, as it will decrease its effectiveness. Try to take it 1-2 hours apart.
STOP ASPIRIN and all other "non steroidal anti-inflammatory drugs" like ibuprofen and naproxen.
Please continue all other medications as previously prescribed.
you will eventually need surgical repair
Annotation: Aftercare instructions - Upcoming Schedules - Specialist appointment
